element.name: TImageData
element.short: Entity class representing image records in the Xolmis database.

descr.p: The TImageData class models metadata and relationships for images stored in the system. It inherits from TXolmisRecord and provides persistence, comparison, and validation methods. Each property corresponds to a field in the image table, including descriptive attributes (filename, subtitle, type), temporal information (date, time), spatial information (longitude, latitude, coordinate precision), and foreign keys linking the image to related entities such as taxa, individuals, captures, surveys, sightings, nests, eggs, specimens, projects, and localities.

The class also stores licensing information (type, year, owner, notes, URI) to ensure proper attribution and usage rights. Utility methods allow cloning, JSON serialization/deserialization, equality checks, difference tracking, and validation of required fields.

element.name: TMediaAttachment
element.short: Record type for linking media attachments to related entities.

descr.p: The TMediaAttachment record encapsulates foreign key identifiers that associate a media file (image, audio, video, or document) with specific entities in the database. Each field corresponds to a possible relation, such as taxon, individual, capture event, locality, or project. This structure is typically filled when attaching media through the import wizard or the attachment dialog, ensuring that the media is properly linked to the relevant biological or administrative context.

element.name: TImageRepository
element.short: Repository class for managing image records.

descr.p: The TImageRepository class provides a repository implementation for handling image records in the Xolmis database. It inherits from TXolmisRepository and overrides core persistence methods to support CRUD operations (create, read, update, delete) on image entities.
This repository encapsulates database access logic, including:

ul.li: Checking if an image record exists by its identifier.
Finding records by arbitrary field values.
Hydrating entity objects (TXolmisRecord) from dataset rows.
Inserting new image records into the database.

descr.p: By centralizing these operations, TImageRepository ensures consistent handling of image data across the application and abstracts the details of SQL queries and dataset manipulation.
